str2: A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.
A Galatian (meaning any inhabitant of the Roman province Galatia). From Galatia; a Galatian or inhabitant of Galatia.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give the evil eye to, fascinate, bewitch, overpower. Akin to phasko; to malign, i.e. to fascinate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural

str2: The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pro and grapho; to write previously; figuratively, to announce, prescribe.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
